revised_title: Anatomy and Function of Nerve Roots in the Brachial Plexus of the Dog
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on dogs to investigate the nerve roots that enter the brachial plexus. They discovered that different nerve roots control various muscle movements and that muscles supplied by one nerve root can have opposing actions. The authors also found that when a nerve root is divided, it causes temporary paresis of the muscles it supplies, and that there is no overflow of impulses to other nerve roots. These findings provide insight into the complex relationships between nerve roots, muscles, and spinal levels.
